text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for your review of the new
Seguros album vinkor quicker if Seguros
is an Icelandic rock band this is their
seventh full-length LP and they play
rock music with this very elegant
refined and climactic character to it a
lot of people label it as post rock and
while Seguros has a lot in common with
other post rock bands they've never
really hesitated to incorporate other
genres of music into their stuff -
including ambient music experimental
rock now after putting out some of their
best records in the late 90s early in
mid 2000s their music these days is
really sort of in this state of change
on their past few records they've been
really evolving their sound taking some
risks bringing in some elements of art
pop or taking things in a very very
ambient direction on their 2012 album
vault re which i think is a record that
is a little underrated yeah it's it's
not as busy or as engaging as some of
their older records but I actually think
the band took to this softer gentler
vibe really well now their latest record
here is really a relative one eighteen
eighteen eighty it's not the heaviest or
darkest album that you're gonna run
across this year definitely but it is
heavier and darker for this band not
only is this album kind of a change for
the band musically but it is a change
for lineup - their longtime keyboardist
Kerry is no longer with them either now
there were some tracks dropped before
the release of this album and and they
were pretty dark and and I feel that
that led a lot of people to expect a
very very dark release from Seguros
tracks that had really heavy distorted
bass like the opener and the title track
- which is actually so thick with
instrumentation that the song becomes a
hellish whirlwind there are all these
weird percussive metallic clangs
throughout the track it is it is very
climactic as well as just sort of
tortured Plus it's one of the few
moments I've ever really heard yawns his
voice come off as sort of sinister
on a track because typically his singing
feels in my opinion very warm friendly
sort of inviting really adding to this
feel and the band's music typically that
that comes off as as being sort of like
I'm listening to something that is being
written within a magical mystical land
like a fairy tale and if that's the case
Quaker is essentially hearing a very
dark cloud of evil roll in on this
magical mystical land now aside from
these incredibly dark tracks there are a
few moments like stormer where you're
hearing the band deliver their usual
blend of instrumentation their usual
atmosphere but there's a touch of
gloominess to it and the closing piano
piece on this album as well when you
compare it to the closing piano piece on
Sega roses last LP it's kind of like
night and day which might be an
intentional thing after all vault re was
one of cigarettes heavenly albums this
new LP is definitely one of the Bands
darker albums may be their sister albums
in a way however I don't want to take it
too far and assume too much especially
since I feel like this new record from
the band only feels dark comparatively I
don't really feel that the dark vibe
permeates every single track on this
album even the songs where I feel like
the band is really trying to get it to
translate there are some tracks on here
that feature some building drums and
strings some joyous horns and sonically
it doesn't really feel that far off from
what the band has done in the past to me
they're actually quite a few tracks on
here that feel that way to me although I
guess I can't fault sigur rós for making
an album that sounds like a cigarette
it's been just about a year since vault
re came out it doesn't feel like the
band is putting any less effort into
this record if there's anything that's
less on this record it is less climactic
and and I feel that is partially because
the band is writing shorter songs on
this thing with structures that are way
more straightforward they're not really
trying to create this sense of vastness
that some of their best songs do they're
not really wandering out or creating
something that feels a little
directionless before they really kind of
deliver a hard or very beautiful climax
I just wish there were more tracks on
this album that felt as dark as the
title track in order to make this new
chain
and the band sound really worth it I
feel that a lot of songs on here sort of
dulled down the bands very lavish and
and pretty sound in order to make an
album that feels like a change of pace
only part of the time for sure I do like
this album I think it will translate
well with fans maybe even better than
Baltar II did because people were really
looking for something more eventful than
what the band had brought on that record
you will have people that listen to this
record after being disappointed by vault
re and think to themselves wow this is
just much more engaging this is better
I'm with this but personally I prefer
vault re to this if you've given this LP
listen what did you think of it did you
loved it did you hate it why what do you
think I should review next and that's it
Anthony Fantana sigur rós
[Music]
